result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge L Marcia-Contreras

Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

09:17 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Jair Chamuel Alvarez.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Fred Svensson interpreted via telephone. State moved for finding of transactional relation between Counts 1-3. No objection. Court made finding. State called first witness. Special Agent Mansavage duly sworn & testified. Direct by State. Cross by defense. State moved for bind over. Objection by defense. Court granted motion for bind over.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:45 AM Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Fayme Filipiak interpreted. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
